  • Automatic updates: Use Obtainium

docs.title: What is Mycel?
docs.text: Mycel is a delay-tolerant mesh messenger for Android. It sends messages by hopping between nearby phones, without requiring internet connectivity.

docs.title: Why "Mycel"?
docs.text: Named after mycelium - the underground fungal network that connects trees in a forest. Like mycelium, Mycel connects devices in a resilient, decentralized network.

docs.title: Is Mycel free?
docs.text: Yes, Mycel is free and open source.

docs.title: Can I use Mycel for emergencies?
docs.text: No. Mycel is not suitable for emergency communications. Delivery can take hours or days with no guarantee of arrival. For emergencies, use official emergency services.

docs.title: Is Mycel on the Play Store?
docs.text: Not currently. Download from GitHub Releases.

docs.title: Why didn't my message send immediately?
docs.text: Mycel needs to find a nearby device to relay your message. If no Mycel users are around, the message waits until an encounter happens.

docs.title: Can I use Mycel without internet?
docs.text: Yes! That's the primary use case. Mycel uses Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Direct to communicate directly with nearby devices.

docs.title: How far can messages travel?
docs.text: With enough relay devices, messages can travel anywhere. Each hop typically covers ~100 meters. Messages ride along with people as they move.

docs.title: Why does delivery take so long?
docs.text: Messages travel through physical encounters between devices. More distance = more hops = more time. This is the trade-off for not requiring internet.

docs.title: Why does Mycel need location permission?
docs.text: Android requires location permission to scan for Bluetooth devices. Mycel doesn't actually track or store your location - it only uses this permission for device discovery.

docs.title: Why does Mycel need background permission?
docs.text: To relay messages when you're not actively using the app. Without background permission, the mesh only works when the app is open.

docs.title: Are my messages encrypted?
docs.text: Yes, all messages are end-to-end encrypted. Only you and your recipient can read them.

docs.title: Can relay devices read my messages?
docs.text: No. Messages are encrypted before leaving your device. Relay devices can only see encrypted data and routing metadata.

docs.title: Is there a server storing my messages?
docs.text: No. Messages are stored only on devices - yours and the relay devices carrying them. No central server exists.

docs.title: Do I need a phone number?
docs.text: No. Mycel identifies you by a cryptographic key, not phone number or email.

docs.title: What Android version do I need?
docs.text: Android 8.0 or higher (API 26+). Full mesh features require Android 10+. Google Play Services is also required.

docs.title: How much storage does Mycel use?
docs.text: The app is ~50 MB. Message storage varies with usage.

docs.title: Does Mycel drain my battery?
docs.text: Mycel uses Bluetooth scanning which does consume some battery. Battery optimization settings can help balance connectivity vs. battery life.

docs.title: What is the Nostr transport?
docs.text: Nostr is an optional internet-based relay. When available, it can speed up delivery. Messages are still encrypted.

docs.title: Messages stuck on "Pending"
docs.text:
• Check that Bluetooth and Wi-Fi are enabled
  • Ensure location permission is granted
  • Make sure the app isn't being killed by battery optimization
  • Be patient - mesh delivery takes time

docs.title: App keeps closing
docs.text:
• Disable battery optimization for Mycel
  • Grant all requested permissions
  • Check that your device meets the requirements

docs.title: Can't find nearby devices
docs.text:
• Both devices need Mycel running
  • Check Bluetooth and Wi-Fi are on
  • Check location services are enabled
  • Try moving closer together

docs.title: How do I update Mycel?
docs.text: Download the latest APK from GitHub Releases and install over your existing version.

docs.title: Can I get automatic updates?
docs.text: Yes, use Obtainium to monitor for new releases.

docs.title: Cannot add Mycel source from GitHub (Obtainium)
docs.text:
If you see a connection error while adding the Mycel source in Obtainium:

  1. Check your internet connection

    • Make sure your device has a stable internet connection
    • Try switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data, then retry

  2. Avoid restricted networks

    • Some networks block or interfere with connections to GitHub
    • If you're using a corporate, hotel, or public Wi-Fi network, try a different network

  3. Disable VPN or network filtering temporarily

    • VPNs, private DNS, or system-wide ad blockers may interrupt the connection
    • Turn them off briefly and try again

  4. Confirm the source URL

    • Make sure the source URL is entered exactly as: https://github.com/ethene/mycel-releases
    • Even small changes or missing characters can cause the connection to fail

  5. Retry after a short wait

    • Temporary network or service issues may resolve on their own
    • Wait a few minutes and try again

  6. Restart the app or device

    • If the error persists, restarting Obtainium or the device can help clear temporary network issues

  7. If the problem continues

    • The issue is usually caused by network restrictions or connectivity problems
    • Try again later or from a different internet connection
    • You can also download the APK directly from GitHub Releases

docs.title: Privacy
docs.text: Mycel is designed with privacy as a core principle.

docs.title: Message Content
docs.text:
• End-to-end encrypted using X25519 key agreement + HKDF-SHA256 + AES-256-GCM
  • Only sender and recipient can decrypt
  • Relay devices see only encrypted blobs

docs.title: Your Identity
docs.text:
• Identified by cryptographic public key, not phone number
  • No account registration required
  • No personal information collected

docs.title: Communication Patterns
docs.text:
• No central server logging who messages whom
  • No company has access to your metadata
  • Messages travel peer-to-peer through the mesh

docs.title: What's Visible to Relay Devices
docs.text:
When another Mycel device relays your message, it can see:

Data Visible? Notes Message content No Encrypted Your real name No Not transmitted Sender public key Yes Part of routing Recipient public key Yes For delivery Message size Yes Approximate Timestamp Yes Approximate

This is similar to a sealed letter - the carrier knows the destination but can't read the contents.

docs.title: What's Visible on Nostr (Internet Relay)
docs.text:
When using the optional Nostr transport:

  • Nostr relay operators can see the same metadata as any relay device
  • They can see when your device connects
  • They cannot read message content (still encrypted)

Nostr is optional

If maximum privacy is required, you can disable Nostr and use only local mesh delivery.

docs.title: Comparison with Other Apps
docs.text: Feature Mycel WhatsApp Signal E2E Encryption Yes Yes Yes Central server No Yes Yes Phone number required No Yes Yes Metadata logged No Yes Limited Works offline Yes No No

docs.title: Threat Model
docs.text:
Mycel protects against:

  • Mass surveillance (no central point to tap)
  • Server compromise (no servers)
  • Network analysis (distributed, encrypted)
  • Eavesdropping (end-to-end encryption)

Mycel does not protect against:

  • Device compromise (if your phone is hacked)
  • Targeted attacks by sophisticated adversaries
  • Traffic analysis by a party monitoring all relay devices

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Keep your device secure - Use strong PIN/biometric
  2. Keep Mycel updated - Security fixes in newer versions
  3. Verify contacts out-of-band - Compare Device IDs in person
  4. Consider Nostr trade-offs - More metadata exposure for faster delivery

docs.title: Threat Model
docs.text: This document describes what Mycel protects against, what it doesn't, and the security assumptions we make.

docs.title: Security Goals
docs.text:
Mycel aims to provide:

  1. Confidentiality - Only sender and recipient can read messages
  2. Authenticity - Messages provably come from claimed sender
  3. Censorship resistance - No single point of control
  4. Privacy - Minimal metadata exposure
  5. Offline operation - Works without internet infrastructure

docs.title: Adversary Capabilities
docs.text: We consider adversaries with varying capabilities:

docs.title: Passive Network Observer
docs.text:
Can: Monitor network traffic, see encrypted payloads Cannot: Read message contents, forge messages

Mycel's defense: End-to-end encryption, signed bundles

docs.title: Relay Node Operator
docs.text:
Can: See bundle metadata (source, destination, size, timing) Cannot: Read message contents, prevent forwarding

Mycel's defense: Encryption makes content unreadable; mesh topology means messages can route around hostile nodes

docs.title: Nostr Relay Operator
docs.text:
Can: See encrypted events, connection timing, IP addresses Cannot: Read message contents, identify users (unless IP reveals identity)

Mycel's defense: NIP-17 gift-wrap encryption, optional relay usage

docs.title: Device Thief
docs.text:
Can: Access all local data if device is unlocked Cannot: Access data if device has screen lock (unless bypassed)

Mycel's defense: None beyond Android's device encryption. We don't implement app-level encryption.

docs.title: Sophisticated Actor (Nation-State)
docs.text:
Can: Potentially monitor many relay nodes, perform traffic analysis, compromise devices Cannot: Break cryptographic primitives

Mycel's defense: Partial. Spray-and-Wait creates multiple paths. Strong crypto protects content. But traffic analysis may reveal communication patterns.

docs.title: What's Protected
docs.text: Property Protection Level Notes Message content Strong AES-256-GCM encryption Sender authenticity Strong Ed25519 signatures Message integrity Strong Signature verification Sender identity Partial Public key visible to relays Recipient identity Partial Public key visible to relays Communication timing Weak Approximate timing visible to relays Communication existence Weak Observers can see "message sent"

docs.title: Endpoint Security
docs.text:
If your device is compromised (malware, physical access), all bets are off. Mycel cannot protect against:

  • Keyloggers capturing messages as you type
  • Screen capture malware
  • Device theft with unlocked phone
  • Malicious Mycel builds

docs.title: Traffic Analysis
docs.text:
A sophisticated adversary monitoring multiple relay nodes could potentially:

  • Correlate message timing to identify communication partners
  • Estimate message frequency between users
  • Build social graphs from observation

docs.title: Metadata at Nostr Relays
docs.text:
When using Nostr transport:

  • Your IP address is visible to relay operators
  • Connection timing reveals activity patterns
  • Relay operators could log and correlate

docs.title: Future Key Compromise
docs.text:
Mycel does not provide forward secrecy:

  • If your private key is compromised, all past messages can be decrypted
  • This is a deliberate trade-off for DTN compatibility
  • Signal-style ratcheting requires synchronized sessions

docs.title: Cryptographic Primitives
docs.text:
Use Case Algorithm Key Size Key agreement X25519 (ECDH) 256-bit Symmetric encryption AES-256-GCM 256-bit Key derivation HKDF-SHA256 - Signing Ed25519 256-bit Hashing SHA-256 256-bit

These primitives are well-studied and considered secure against classical computers.

docs.title: Security Assumptions
docs.text:
Mycel's security relies on:

  1. Cryptographic hardness - X25519, AES-256, Ed25519 remain secure
  2. Random number generation - Android's SecureRandom works correctly
  3. No device compromise - Your phone isn't rooted/malware-infected
  4. Key secrecy - Your private key hasn't leaked

docs.title: No Perfect Forward Secrecy
docs.text:
Traditional forward secrecy requires: - Real-time key negotiation - Synchronized sessions - Both parties online

This is incompatible with DTN where messages may arrive days later.

Implication: Compromise of your private key compromises all past messages.

docs.title: No Deniability
docs.text: Messages are cryptographically signed. You cannot plausibly deny having sent a message - the signature proves it.

docs.title: Limited Anonymity
docs.text: Your public key is visible to relay nodes. If your key is associated with your real identity (e.g., you shared it publicly), relays learn you're communicating.

docs.title: Threat Comparison
docs.text: Threat Protection Mass surveillance Strong - No central point to tap Targeted surveillance Partial - Traffic analysis possible Eavesdropping Strong - E2E encryption Message tampering Strong - Signatures Impersonation Strong - Signatures Censorship Strong - No single point of control Device theft (locked) Depends on Android encryption Device theft (unlocked) None Malware on device None Rubber hose cryptanalysis None

docs.title: For Casual Users
docs.text:
1. Use device screen lock
  2. Keep Mycel updated
  3. Verify contacts' identities in person

docs.title: For High-Risk Users
docs.text:
1. All of the above, plus:
  2. Consider disabling Nostr (mesh-only mode)
  3. Use a dedicated device
  4. Verify APK checksums
  5. Assume sophisticated adversaries can perform traffic analysis
  6. Consider message content carefully - encryption protects transit, not endpoints

See Also: Privacy | APK Verification | Encryption Deep Dive

docs.title: APK Verification
docs.text: Verify that you downloaded an authentic Mycel APK.

docs.title: Quick Start: Use Obtainium
docs.text:
The easiest way to install and verify Mycel is with Obtainium:

  1. Install Obtainium from F-Droid or GitHub
  2. Add Mycel: https://github.com/ethene/mycel-releases
  3. Install - Obtainium verifies signatures automatically

For manual verification, continue below.

docs.title: Why Verify?
docs.text:
Malicious actors could distribute modified APKs. Verification ensures:

  • The APK is from the official source
  • It hasn't been tampered with
  • It's signed with the official key

docs.title: Official Signing Certificate
docs.text:
All official Mycel releases are signed with this certificate:

Field Value Subject CN=Dmitry Stakhin, OU=Mycelium Labs, O=Quantum Research Pty Ltd, L=Brisbane, ST=QLD, C=AU SHA-256 446a854ca21ef946e1ae192a685cde06a791d4ae8e9eb3844a9ef537fa688d6d SHA-1 592aba950d84078284afaa14f6b533fe7d9b8306

If the fingerprint doesn't match

Do not install the APK. You may have downloaded a tampered version.

docs.title: Method 1: SHA-256 Checksum
docs.text: Each release includes a .sha256 file with the expected checksum.

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
sha256sum Mycel-v*.apk
cat Mycel-v*.apk.sha256
# Compare the two outputs

docs.title: macOS
docs.text:
shasum -a 256 Mycel-v*.apk
cat Mycel-v*.apk.sha256

docs.title: Windows (PowerShell)
docs.text:
Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 Mycel-v*.apk
Get-Content Mycel-v*.apk.sha256

docs.title: Windows (CMD)
docs.text:
certutil -hashfile Mycel-v2.0.723.apk SHA256
type Mycel-v2.0.723.apk.sha256

Match = OK

If checksums match, the file hasn't been modified.

docs.title: Using apksigner (Android SDK)
docs.text:
apksigner verify --print-certs Mycel-v*.apk

Look for: 

Signer #1 certificate SHA-256 digest: 446a854ca21ef946e1ae192a685cde06a791d4ae8e9eb3844a9ef537fa688d6d

docs.title: Using keytool (Java)
docs.text:
keytool -printcert -jarfile Mycel-v*.apk

Check the SHA-256 fingerprint matches the official certificate.

docs.title: Official Download Sources
docs.text:
Source URL Verification GitHub Releases github.com/ethene/mycel-releases Manual Obtainium https://github.com/ethene/mycel-releases Automatic

Unofficial sources

APKs from other sources (APK mirrors, forums, Telegram) may be modified. Always verify or use Obtainium.

docs.title: What If Verification Fails?
docs.text:
1. Delete the APK - Do not install it
  2. Re-download from official source - File may have been corrupted
  3. Try a different browser - Some browsers modify downloads
  4. Report the issue - Open an issue if official downloads don't verify

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text: Everything you need to know about using Mycel day-to-day.

docs.title: Conversations
docs.text:
Mycel supports three types of conversations:

Type Who can read Who can post Best for Direct Messages You and one contact Both of you Private 1:1 chats Groups Group members Any member Team discussions Channels Anyone subscribed Channel owner only Announcements, broadcasts

There's also Mesh Broadcast - a special local chat shared with everyone nearby.

docs.title: Getting Connected
docs.text:
• Contacts - Share your identity, add friends, manage contacts
  • Settings - Customize appearance, notifications, and network options

docs.title: Understanding Delivery
docs.text:
• How Delivery Works - Why messages take time and how the mesh works
  • Battery & Background - Keep the mesh running while saving battery

docs.title: Message Status Icons
docs.text: Icon Meaning Clock Pending - waiting for relay opportunity Single check Forwarding - traveling through the mesh Double check Delivered - reached recipient

docs.title: Common Tasks
docs.text:
I want to... Go to Send a message Messaging Create a group Groups Share my contact Contacts Adjust notifications Settings Check network status Settings

Next: Messaging | Groups | Contacts

docs.title: Battery & Background Behavior
docs.text: Mycel needs to run in the background to relay messages. Here's what to expect and how to optimize.

docs.title: Why Background Operation Matters
docs.text:
Unlike traditional messengers that rely on push notifications from a server, Mycel must:

  • Continuously scan for nearby devices
  • Maintain connections with encountered peers
  • Store and forward messages for others

If Mycel stops running, your phone drops out of the mesh network.

docs.title: Battery Impact
docs.text:
Usage Pattern Battery Impact Relay Effectiveness App in foreground High Best App in background (unrestricted) Medium Good App in background (restricted) Low Poor App killed by system None None

Typical consumption: 3-8% of daily battery depending on activity and number of nearby peers.

docs.title: Android's Background Restrictions
docs.text: Modern Android aggressively kills background apps. You need to configure your phone to let Mycel run:

docs.title: 1. Disable Battery Optimization
docs.text:
Settings > Apps > Mycel > Battery > Unrestricted

This tells Android not to limit Mycel's background activity.

docs.title: 2. Lock the App (Some Phones)
docs.text:
Some manufacturers (Xiaomi, Huawei, Samsung) have extra battery management:

Brand Where to Find Xiaomi Settings > Battery > App battery saver > Mycel > No restrictions Huawei Settings > Battery > App launch > Mycel > Manage manually > Enable all Samsung Settings > Device care > Battery > App power management > Mycel > Don't optimize OnePlus Settings > Battery > Battery optimization > Mycel > Don't optimize

Don't Kill My App

Visit dontkillmyapp.com for device-specific instructions.

docs.title: 3. Allow Background Location
docs.text:
Settings > Apps > Mycel > Permissions > Location > Allow all the time

Without this, Bluetooth scanning stops when you lock your phone.

docs.title: Phone Goes to Sleep
docs.text: With proper settings, Mycel continues scanning and relaying. The app icon stays in the notification bar.

docs.title: Battery Saver Mode
docs.text: Most battery saver modes will restrict Mycel. Consider adding Mycel to exceptions, or disable battery saver during important communication periods.

docs.title: Phone Restarts
docs.text: Mycel automatically starts when your phone boots. You'll see the notification icon appear.

docs.title: App Is Force-Stopped
docs.text: Force-stopping completely kills Mycel. You must manually reopen the app to rejoin the mesh.

docs.title: If You Need Maximum Battery Life
docs.text:
1. Use Mycel primarily when you need it (emergencies, events)
  2. Close the app when returning to internet connectivity
  3. Reduce scanning intensity in Settings (future feature)

docs.title: If You Want Best Mesh Relay
docs.text:
1. Keep Mycel running at all times
  2. Keep phone charged or carry a power bank
  3. Grant all permissions and disable optimizations
  4. Don't use battery saver mode

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text:
Mycel shows a persistent notification when running in background:

Mycel is running Mesh relay active

This notification:

  • Indicates the app is working
  • Prevents Android from killing the app
  • Shows current connection status

You can minimize this notification, but don't disable it entirely.

docs.title: "Mycel keeps stopping"
docs.text:
1. Check battery optimization settings
  2. Check manufacturer-specific settings
  3. Exclude Mycel from battery saver
  4. Don't use "Clean" or "Boost" apps that kill background services

docs.title: "Not receiving messages when screen is off"
docs.text:
1. Ensure background location is "Allow all the time"
  2. Check persistent notification is visible
  3. Verify battery optimization is disabled

docs.title: "High battery usage"
docs.text:
1. This is normal if there are many nearby peers
  2. Reduce scanning interval (future feature)
  3. Use only when needed if battery is critical

See Also: Permissions | How Delivery Works

docs.title: Channels
docs.text: Channels are read-only broadcasts where only the owner (author) can post messages. Subscribers receive updates but cannot reply in the channel.

docs.title: When to Use Channels
docs.text:
Channels are perfect for:

  • Announcements - Company updates, community news
  • Newsletters - Regular updates to followers
  • Alerts - Emergency notifications, status updates
  • One-way communication - When you need to broadcast without discussion

Need discussion?

If you want members to reply, use a Group instead.

docs.title: Channels vs Groups
docs.text: Feature Channel Group Who can post Owner only Any member Join method Subscribe (anyone) Invite or join Purpose Broadcasts Discussions Author verification Yes (signed) No Replies Not in channel Yes

docs.title: Mesh Local Channels
docs.text:
• Range: Local mesh only (nearby devices)
  • Transport: Nearby Connections (Bluetooth/Wi-Fi)
  • Best for: Local announcements, event updates

docs.title: Global Channels (Future)
docs.text:
• Range: Worldwide via internet
  • Transport: Nostr relays
  • Status: Planned for future release

docs.title: Step by Step
docs.text:
1. Open Mycel and go to Chats
  2. Tap the Channels sub-tab
  3. Tap the + (floating action button)
  4. Enter a Channel Name (required)
  5. Optionally add a Description
  6. Tap Create Channel

You're now the channel owner and can start posting.

docs.title: What You Can Do as Owner
docs.text:
• Post messages to all subscribers
  • View subscriber count
  • Delete the channel
  • All your posts are cryptographically signed

docs.title: Finding Channels
docs.text:
Channels can be discovered through:

  • Direct share - Someone sends you a channel link/ID
  • QR code - Scan a channel's QR code
  • Nearby discovery - Channels can broadcast their existence

docs.title: Subscribing
docs.text:
1. Open the channel preview
  2. Review the channel info:
  3. Name and description
  4. Owner identity
  5. Subscriber count
  6. Tap Subscribe

After subscribing:

  • The channel appears in your Channels tab
  • You'll receive new posts as they're broadcast
  • You can read all future messages

docs.title: Unsubscribing
docs.text:
1. Open the channel
  2. Tap the channel header
  3. Tap Unsubscribe
  4. Confirm

You'll stop receiving new messages. The channel moves to your archive.

docs.title: Message Display
docs.text:
Channel messages show:

  • Author name - Who posted (channel owner)
  • Timestamp - When posted
  • Message content - The actual message
  • Verification status - Signature check passed

docs.title: Message Actions
docs.text:
Even though you can't reply in the channel, you can:

  • Copy - Copy message text
  • Forward - Send to a contact or group
  • View info - See message details and verification

docs.title: Posting to Your Channel
docs.text:
As the channel owner:

  1. Open your channel
  2. Type your message in the compose area
  3. Tap Send

Your message is:

  1. Signed with your Ed25519 key (proves you wrote it)
  2. Encrypted (optional, for private channels)
  3. Broadcast to all subscribers via the mesh

docs.title: Post Delivery
docs.text:
Channel posts travel through the mesh like other messages:

Status Meaning Pending Waiting for relay Forwarding Traveling through mesh Broadcast Sent to mesh

No per-subscriber delivery tracking

Unlike DMs, channel posts don't track delivery to individual subscribers. Once broadcast, the message spreads through the mesh.

docs.title: Per-Channel Settings
docs.text:
1. Open the channel
  2. Tap the header
  3. Toggle Mute to silence notifications
  4. Choose duration if muting

docs.title: Global Settings
docs.text:
In Settings > Notifications, you can control:

  • Popup notifications for all channels
  • Sound and vibration
  • (Mesh Group has its own toggle)

docs.title: Why It Matters
docs.text: Anyone could claim to be a channel owner. Mycel prevents impersonation through cryptographic signatures.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
1. When you create a channel, your public key is associated with it
  2. Every post you make is signed with your private key
  3. Subscribers verify the signature before displaying the message
  4. Invalid signatures are rejected

docs.title: What You See
docs.text:
• Verified - Signature matches the channel owner
  • Unverified/Warning - Something doesn't match (rare, investigate)

docs.title: Viewing Subscribers
docs.text:
Currently, you can see:

  • Total subscriber count
  • Channel creation date
  • Your ownership status

Individual subscriber lists are not shown (privacy).

docs.title: Deleting Your Channel
docs.text:
1. Open your channel
  2. Tap the header
  3. Tap Delete Channel
  4. Confirm

Deletion is permanent

Deleting a channel removes it from your device. Subscribers may still have cached messages.

docs.title: Emergency Alerts
docs.text:
Create a channel for your community or building:

  • Post emergency updates
  • Share evacuation info
  • Coordinate during disasters
  • Works without internet

docs.title: Event Announcements
docs.text:
At a festival, conference, or gathering:

  • Announce schedule changes
  • Share location updates
  • Post important reminders
  • Reaches nearby attendees via mesh

docs.title: Community Updates
docs.text:
For neighborhoods or local groups:

  • Share community news
  • Post meeting reminders
  • Announce local events
  • No internet required

docs.title: Team Broadcasts
docs.text:
For work teams in the field:

  • Send instructions to all team members
  • Share status updates
  • Coordinate activities
  • Works in remote areas

docs.title: For Channel Owners
docs.text:
• Be concise - Channel messages should be clear and actionable
  • Post sparingly - Too many posts = subscribers mute you
  • Use descriptive names - Help people understand your channel's purpose
  • Share your channel - Give people the ID or QR code to subscribe

docs.title: For Subscribers
docs.text:
• Mute noisy channels - Keep important channels unmuted
  • Forward useful messages - Share to contacts who might benefit
  • Unsubscribe from inactive channels - Keep your list clean

docs.title: "I'm not receiving channel posts"
docs.text:
• Check subscription - Open Channels tab, verify you're subscribed
  • Check mute status - The channel might be muted
  • Check connectivity - Go to Mesh Lab > Nearby
  • Is the owner posting? - The channel might be inactive

docs.title: "My posts aren't being delivered"
docs.text:
• Check connectivity - Ensure you're connected to the mesh
  • Check Queue - Go to Mesh Lab > Queue to see pending posts
  • Wait for subscribers - Posts only reach people in the mesh

docs.title: "Signature verification failed"
docs.text:
This is rare and could indicate:

  • Corrupted message - Try refreshing
  • Impersonation attempt - Someone trying to fake posts (blocked)
  • Bug - Report if it persists

docs.title: Technical Details
docs.text:
For developers and curious users:

Property Value Encryption AES-256-GCM (optional) Author signatures Ed25519 Message TTL 4 hours default Routing Topic-based (interest filter)

Deep Dive: Channels Technical Details

Next: Mesh Broadcast | Groups | Contacts

docs.title: Contacts
docs.text: Contacts are people you can message directly. This guide covers understanding your identity, sharing it with others, and managing your contact list.

docs.title: What Identifies You
docs.text:
In Mycel, you're identified by a cryptographic key pair, not a phone number or email:

Component Description Shareable? Public Key Your identity that others see Yes Private Key Secret key for signing/decrypting Never Device UID Short ID derived from public key Yes MycTag Human-readable fingerprint Yes

docs.title: Finding Your Identity
docs.text:
1. Open Mycel
  2. Go to Settings
  3. Tap Profile or your avatar
  4. View your:
  5. QR code (for easy sharing)
  6. Device UID (short and full hex)
  7. Public key fingerprint
  8. Display name

docs.title: Understanding UIDs
docs.text:
Your Device UID is a unique identifier:

  • Short form: 10-12 characters, easier to share verbally
  • Full hex: Complete identifier for technical use

Example: LH6nQx... (short) or 4c48366e51782e... (full)

docs.title: Via QR Code
docs.text:
The easiest way to share:

  1. Go to Settings > Profile
  2. Your QR code is displayed
  3. Have the other person scan it with Mycel

The QR code contains:

  • Your public key
  • Your display name
  • Optional: location hint

docs.title: Via Copy/Paste
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Profile
  2. Tap Copy next to your UID
  3. Send via any messaging app
  4. Recipient enters the UID manually in Mycel

docs.title: Via System Share
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings > Profile
  2. Tap Share
  3. Choose any app (text, email, etc.)
  4. Your contact info is shared as text

docs.title: Scanning a QR Code
docs.text:
1. Open Mycel
  2. Go to Contacts tab
  3. Tap the QR scanner icon
  4. Point your camera at their QR code
  5. Contact is added automatically

After scanning:

  • Their info appears in your contacts
  • You can immediately start a conversation

docs.title: Manual Entry
docs.text:
If you received a UID via text:

  1. Go to Contacts tab
  2. Tap Add Contact or +
  3. Enter their Device UID
  4. Optionally add a nickname
  5. Tap Save

Verify the UID

Make sure you've entered the UID correctly. A typo means messages go nowhere.

docs.title: Automatic Discovery
docs.text:
When you're near other Mycel users:

  1. Devices detect each other via Bluetooth/Wi-Fi
  2. Public profiles are exchanged
  3. New contacts appear in your list with a badge

You don't need to explicitly add nearby users - they're discovered automatically.

docs.title: Discovery vs Contacts
docs.text: Discovered Peers Saved Contacts Added automatically Yes No Persist after leaving range Temporarily Yes Can message Yes Yes Shows in Contacts Yes (as neighbors) Yes

docs.title: New Contact Badge
docs.text:
When new contacts are discovered:

  • A badge appears on the Contacts tab
  • New contacts are highlighted in the list
  • Badge clears when you view the contacts

docs.title: Viewing Contact Profiles
docs.text:
1. Go to Contacts
  2. Tap a contact's name or avatar
  3. View their profile:
  4. Display name
  5. Device UID
  6. Public key fingerprint
  7. Last seen time
  8. Online status

docs.title: Renaming Contacts
docs.text:
You can set a local nickname that only you see:

  1. Open the contact's profile
  2. Tap Rename or the edit icon
  3. Enter your preferred name
  4. Save

The nickname:

  • Only appears on your device
  • Doesn't change their actual name
  • Helps you identify contacts

docs.title: Contact Status
docs.text: Status Meaning Online Connected within last 15 seconds Offline Not currently connected Last seen Time of last connection

docs.title: Searching Contacts
docs.text:
In the Contacts tab:

  1. Use the search bar at the top
  2. Search by:
  3. Name/nickname
  4. Device UID
  5. Fingerprint

docs.title: From Contacts
docs.text:
1. Go to Contacts
  2. Tap a contact
  3. Tap Message or the chat icon
  4. Start typing

docs.title: From Contact Profile
docs.text:
1. Open the contact's profile
  2. Tap Start Chat or Message

docs.title: Quick Actions
docs.text:
• Long-press a contact for quick actions
  • Swipe for common operations (varies by device)

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
Contact information syncs through the mesh:

  1. When you meet someone, profiles are exchanged
  2. Profile updates (name changes) propagate
  3. Deleted contacts stay deleted locally

docs.title: What Syncs
docs.text:
• Display names
  • Public keys
  • Optional location hints
  • Profile sequence numbers

docs.title: What Doesn't Sync
docs.text:
• Your local nicknames
  • Message history
  • Contact groupings/organization

docs.title: What Contacts See About You
docs.text:
When you're nearby, others can see:

  • Your display name
  • Your Device UID
  • Your public key
  • That you're running Mycel
  • Approximate location (you're "nearby")

docs.title: What You Control
docs.text:
• Display name - Set whatever you're comfortable sharing
  • Full name - Optional, can leave blank
  • Location sharing - Opt-in for geo-routing (city-level, not precise)

docs.title: Recommendations
docs.text:
1. Use a nickname - Don't use your real name if privacy-conscious
  2. Review settings - Check what you're sharing in Profile settings
  3. Be aware - Nearby discovery means strangers know you're there

docs.title: "Contact not found"
docs.text:
• Check the UID - Make sure you entered it correctly
  • Check connectivity - You may need to be in range first
  • Try scanning QR - More reliable than manual entry

docs.title: "Can't scan QR code"
docs.text:
• Check camera permission - Mycel needs camera access
  • Improve lighting - QR codes need good visibility
  • Hold steady - Keep the phone still while scanning
  • Check distance - Not too close, not too far

docs.title: "Contact shows offline"
docs.text:
• They may not be nearby - Offline is normal when not in range
  • Check your connectivity - Go to Mesh Lab > Nearby
  • Be patient - Status updates when you reconnect

docs.title: "I accidentally added wrong contact"
docs.text:
• You can remove contacts from your list
  • Find them in Contacts, open profile, look for Remove/Delete option
  • Message history remains but is archived

docs.title: "Duplicate contacts"
docs.text:
Can happen if someone:

  • Reinstalled the app (new identity)
  • Has multiple devices

Each device generates a unique identity, so the same person on two devices = two contacts.

docs.title: Pinning Conversations
docs.text:
Important contacts can be pinned:

  1. Go to Chats > Direct Messages
  2. Swipe right on a conversation
  3. Tap Pin

Pinned conversations stay at the top.

docs.title: Archiving Conversations
docs.text:
To hide inactive conversations:

  1. Swipe left on a conversation
  2. Tap Archive

Archived conversations move to the Archive tab.

docs.title: Finding Archived Contacts
docs.text:
1. Go to Chats
  2. Tap Archived tab
  3. View and restore as needed

docs.title: Key Types
docs.text: Key Algorithm Purpose Identity Ed25519 Signing, authentication Encryption X25519 Key agreement for DMs

docs.title: Profile Data
docs.text:
Each contact profile includes:

  • Public key (Ed25519)
  • Display name
  • Full name (optional)
  • Device label
  • Location hint (H3 cell, optional)
  • Profile sequence number
  • Last updated timestamp

Deep Dive: Keys & Cryptography

Next: Messaging | Settings | Groups

docs.title: How Delivery Works
docs.text: Understanding Mycel's delivery model helps set the right expectations.

docs.title: The Store-and-Forward Model
docs.text:
Mycel uses Delay-Tolerant Networking (DTN) - messages are stored on devices and forwarded when opportunities arise.

graph LR
    A[Your Phone] -->|Encounter| B[Relay Phone]
    B -->|Carries message| B
    B -->|Encounter| C[Friend's Phone]
    C -->|ACK| B
    B -->|ACK| A
  1. Store - Your message is stored on your device
  2. Forward - When you encounter another Mycel user, the message is handed off
  3. Repeat - That device stores and forwards to others
  4. Deliver - Eventually the message reaches your friend
  5. Acknowledge - A confirmation travels back to you

docs.title: Delivery Times
docs.text:
Scenario Typical Time Same room/building Seconds to minutes Same neighborhood Minutes to hours Same city Hours Different cities Hours to days Remote/sparse areas Days or longer

No guarantees

If there's no chain of Mycel users between you and your recipient, the message will wait indefinitely. This is a fundamental property of mesh networking.

docs.title: Distance
docs.text: More physical distance = more hops needed = longer delivery.

docs.title: User Density
docs.text: More Mycel users in an area = more relay opportunities = faster delivery.

docs.title: Movement
docs.text: People moving around create more encounters. A message might travel across a city by riding along with commuters.

docs.title: Time of Day
docs.text: More active hours (daytime, rush hour) = more encounters.

docs.title: Multi-Path Delivery
docs.text:
Mycel sends your message via multiple paths simultaneously:

  • Nearby (Bluetooth/Wi-Fi) - Direct device-to-device
  • Nostr (Internet relay) - If both you and recipient have internet

The first path to succeed "wins" - duplicates are automatically filtered.

docs.title: Message Expiration
docs.text:
Messages have a time-to-live (TTL). If not delivered within the TTL, the message expires and is removed from the network.

Message Type Default TTL Direct Messages 24 hours Group Invites 7 days Group Updates 24 hours Channel Messages 4 hours

Expired messages show status EXP in the app.

docs.title: Acknowledgments (ACKs)
docs.text:
When your message is delivered:

  1. Recipient's device generates an ACK
  2. ACK travels back through the mesh (or via internet)
  3. Your app updates the message status to "Delivered"

ACKs help Mycel learn which routes work best for future messages.

docs.title: Tips for Reliable Delivery
docs.text:
1. Keep the app running - Background operation is essential
  2. Grant all permissions - Especially background location
  3. Don't force-stop the app - Let it run
  4. Be patient - Mesh delivery takes time
  5. Encourage friends to use Mycel - More users = better mesh

docs.title: Comparison with Traditional Messaging
docs.text: Feature Traditional (WhatsApp, etc.) Mycel Requires internet Yes No Delivery time Instant Seconds to days Central server Yes No Works offline No Yes Guaranteed delivery Yes (when online) Best-effort

docs.title: Groups
docs.text: Groups let multiple people chat together. Unlike channels, any member can post messages.

docs.title: Groups vs Other Conversation Types
docs.text: Feature Direct Message Group Channel Participants 2 people Multiple members Unlimited subscribers Who can post Both Any member Owner only Join method Add contact Invite (private) or join (public) Subscribe Encryption Yes Yes Yes Best for Private 1:1 Team chats, friends Announcements

docs.title: Private Groups
docs.text:
• Invite-only - Members must be invited by an admin
  • Hidden - Don't appear in public discovery
  • Secure - Group key shared only via encrypted invites

docs.title: Public Groups
docs.text:
• Open - Anyone can join by knowing the group ID
  • Discoverable - Can appear in group announcements
  • Convenient - Easier to share, less secure

docs.title: Step by Step
docs.text:
1. Open Mycel and go to the Chats tab
  2. Tap the Groups sub-tab
  3. Tap the + (floating action button)
  4. Enter a Group Name (required)
  5. Optionally add a Description
  6. Choose Private or Public:
  7. Private: Members must be invited
  8. Public: Anyone can join with the group ID
  9. Tap Create Group

You're now the group's admin and can start inviting members.

docs.title: What Happens Behind the Scenes
docs.text:
When you create a group:

  1. A unique group ID is generated
  2. A 256-bit encryption key is created for the group
  3. You become the admin (only admins can invite/remove members in private groups)
  4. The group is ready to use immediately

docs.title: To a Private Group
docs.text:
As the admin:

  1. Open the group chat
  2. Tap the group name/header to view group info
  3. Tap Invite Members or Add Member
  4. Select contacts from your contact list
  5. Tap Send Invite

The invite is encrypted specifically for each recipient. When they accept:

  • They receive the group key
  • They're added to the member list
  • They can see group messages and post

docs.title: To a Public Group
docs.text:
For public groups, you can:

  • Share the group ID directly (they can join themselves)
  • Use the invite flow above (works the same way)

Invites work offline

Group invites travel through the mesh like regular messages. Recipients can accept invites even if you're not online at the same time.

docs.title: Receiving and Accepting Invites
docs.text:
When someone invites you to a group:

  1. You'll receive a notification (if enabled)
  2. The invite appears in your message list
  3. Tap the invite to view group details:
  4. Group name
  5. Who invited you
  6. Current member count
  7. Tap Join Group to accept

After joining:

  • The group appears in your Groups tab
  • You can see message history (from the time of your join)
  • You can post messages

docs.title: Declining Invites
docs.text: Simply ignore the invite or dismiss it. You won't be added to the group.

docs.title: Viewing Members
docs.text:
1. Open the group chat
  2. Tap the group header
  3. View the member list with roles:
  4. Admin - Can invite/remove members
  5. Member - Can read and post

docs.title: Adding Members (Admin Only)
docs.text:
1. Open group info
  2. Tap Add Member or Invite
  3. Select contacts
  4. Send invites

docs.title: Removing Members (Admin Only)
docs.text:
1. Open group info
  2. Find the member in the list
  3. Tap their name or the remove option
  4. Confirm removal

Removed members keep old messages

When you remove someone, they lose access to new messages but can still read messages they received before removal. The group key is not rotated.

docs.title: Promoting to Admin
docs.text:
Admins can promote other members:

  1. Open group info
  2. Tap a member's name
  3. Select Make Admin

docs.title: Posting in Groups
docs.text:
Posting works like direct messages:

  1. Open the group
  2. Type your message
  3. Tap Send

Your message is:

  1. Encrypted with the group key
  2. Sent to all members via the mesh
  3. Delivered as members come into contact with relays

docs.title: Message Delivery in Groups
docs.text:
Group messages travel the same way as direct messages - through the mesh. Each member receives the message independently, so delivery times may vary per member.

Status Meaning Pending Waiting for relay opportunity Forwarding Traveling through mesh Delivered Reached at least one member

docs.title: Leaving a Group
docs.text:
To leave a group:

  1. Open the group chat
  2. Tap the group header
  3. Scroll to the bottom
  4. Tap Leave Group
  5. Confirm

After leaving:

  • You're removed from the member list
  • You won't receive new messages
  • The group remains in your history (archived)
  • You can't rejoin private groups without a new invite

docs.title: Muting a Group
docs.text:
To mute notifications for a specific group:

  1. Open the group
  2. Tap the group header
  3. Toggle Mute on
  4. Choose mute duration (1 hour, 8 hours, 1 day, forever)

Muted groups still receive messages, but won't trigger notifications.

docs.title: Global Group Settings
docs.text:
In Settings > Notifications:

  • Mesh Group notifications - Toggle alerts for the built-in mesh broadcast
  • Popup notifications - Show floating alerts
  • Sound / Vibration - Audio and haptic feedback

docs.title: Group Sync and CRDT
docs.text: Groups use a special technology called CRDT (Conflict-free Replicated Data Type) to sync membership across all members, even when they're offline.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
• Each member change (add/remove) is recorded with a timestamp
  • When members reconnect, changes are merged automatically
  • The same final state is reached regardless of the order changes are received

docs.title: What This Means for You
docs.text:
• Offline-friendly - Membership changes sync whenever devices meet
  • Consistent - Everyone eventually sees the same member list
  • No conflicts - Simultaneous changes are handled automatically

docs.title: For Better Delivery
docs.text:
• Keep the app running - Background operation helps relay group messages
  • More members = better mesh - Each member can relay to others
  • Be patient - Group messages may take longer than DMs (more recipients)

docs.title: For Privacy
docs.text:
• Use private groups for sensitive discussions
  • Verify invites - Make sure you know who invited you
  • Admin carefully - Only promote trusted members to admin

docs.title: For Organization
docs.text:
• Use descriptive names - Makes groups easy to find
  • Archive old groups - Swipe left to archive inactive groups
  • Pin important groups - Swipe right to pin frequently used groups

docs.title: "I can't add someone to my group"
docs.text:
• Are you an admin? Only admins can invite members in private groups
  • Do you have their contact? You can only invite people in your contact list
  • Is the invite stuck? Check Mesh Lab > Queue for pending invites

docs.title: "I didn't receive a group invite"
docs.text:
• Check your message list - Invites appear as special messages
  • Is the sender nearby? Invites travel through the mesh like messages
  • Check permissions - Ensure Mycel has notification permission

docs.title: "Group messages aren't arriving"
docs.text:
• Check connectivity - Go to Mesh Lab > Nearby to see if you're connected
  • Is the group muted? Check group settings
  • Are other members online? Group messages need relay paths

docs.title: "I accidentally left a group"
docs.text:
• Private groups - Ask an admin to send a new invite
  • Public groups - Rejoin using the group ID

docs.title: Technical Details
docs.text:
For developers and curious users:

Property Value Encryption AES-256-GCM with shared group key Key distribution ECIES (X25519 + XChaCha20-Poly1305) Membership sync 2P-Set CRDT Max members ~100 (practical limit) Message TTL 24 hours default

Deep Dive: Private Groups Technical Details

Next: Channels | Mesh Broadcast | Contacts

docs.title: Mesh Broadcast
docs.text: The Mesh Broadcast (shown as "Mesh Group" in the app) is a special built-in channel that connects you with everyone nearby running Mycel.

docs.title: What is Mesh Broadcast?
docs.text:
Think of it as a local walkie-talkie channel - anyone within range can hear and talk.

Property Mesh Broadcast Range Local mesh only (nearby devices) Who can read Anyone nearby with Mycel Who can post Anyone Encryption None (plaintext) Always on Yes, cannot unsubscribe

docs.title: vs Direct Messages
docs.text: Direct Message Mesh Broadcast Recipients One specific person Everyone nearby Privacy End-to-end encrypted Public/plaintext Delivery Store-and-forward Local flood

docs.title: vs Groups
docs.text: Group Mesh Broadcast Membership Explicit (invite/join) Automatic (all nearby) Persistence Long-term Ephemeral Encryption Yes No Scope Selected members Geographic

docs.title: vs Channels
docs.text: Channel Mesh Broadcast Author Single owner Anyone Subscription Opt-in Always on Verification Signed messages None Purpose Announcements Local chat

docs.title: Good Use Cases
docs.text:
• "Is anyone out there?" - Finding other Mycel users nearby
  • Local coordination - Quick messages at events
  • Emergencies - Reaching anyone within range
  • Testing - Verifying your mesh connection works
  • Casual chat - Talking with nearby strangers

docs.title: Not Recommended For
docs.text:
• Private conversations - Use DMs instead (encrypted)
  • Sensitive information - Messages are not encrypted
  • Long-term discussions - Use groups instead
  • Specific recipients - Use DMs or groups

No encryption

Mesh Broadcast messages are not encrypted. Anyone on the mesh can read them. Don't share sensitive information.

docs.title: Finding It
docs.text:
1. Open Mycel
  2. Go to Chats
  3. Look for "Mesh Group" at the top of your conversations
  4. Or find it in a dedicated section

docs.title: Sending a Message
docs.text:
1. Open Mesh Group
  2. Type your message
  3. Tap Send

Your message floods across the local mesh immediately.

docs.title: Reading Messages
docs.text:
Messages appear in chronological order showing:

  • Sender name - Who posted
  • Timestamp - When posted
  • Message text - The content

docs.title: Who Receives Your Messages?
docs.text:
Everyone who:

  • Is running Mycel
  • Is within Bluetooth/Wi-Fi range (directly or via relays)
  • Has the app active (foreground or background)

docs.title: What's Visible
docs.text:
When you post to Mesh Broadcast:

  • Your display name is shown
  • Your device UID is included
  • The message content is plaintext
  • Your approximate location (you're "nearby")

docs.title: What's NOT Protected
docs.text:
• Message content is not encrypted
  • Anyone on the mesh can read it
  • Messages may be relayed through other devices
  • No delivery confirmations

docs.title: Recommendations
docs.text:
1. Don't share personal info - No addresses, phone numbers, etc.
  2. Assume public - Treat it like shouting in a crowd
  3. Use for coordination only - Switch to DMs for private follow-ups
  4. Be respectful - You're talking to strangers

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
1. You send a message to Mesh Group
  2. It's wrapped in a MeshBroadcastPayload:
  3. Message ID
  4. Text content
  5. Your UID
  6. Your display name
  7. Timestamp
  8. The message floods across Nearby Connections
  9. Every device in range receives and displays it

docs.title: Flooding vs Routing
docs.text:
Unlike DMs and groups that use intelligent routing, Mesh Broadcast uses flooding:

  • Message sent to all connected peers
  • Each peer forwards to their peers
  • No destination targeting
  • Reaches maximum local coverage

docs.title: TTL (Time to Live)
docs.text:
Mesh Broadcast messages have a short TTL:

  • 4 hours default
  • Prevents old messages from circulating forever
  • Appropriate for ephemeral local chat

docs.title: Controlling Mesh Group Alerts
docs.text:
1. Go to Settings
  2. Find Notifications
  3. Toggle Mesh Group notifications

When disabled:

  • You still receive Mesh Group messages
  • They just don't trigger alerts
  • Useful if the local mesh is chatty

docs.title: At a Conference
docs.text:
You: "Anyone here from the networking track?"
Stranger: "Yeah! Where's the next session?"
You: "Room 204, starting in 10 min"

docs.title: During an Emergency
docs.text:
You: "Power out in building A, anyone have info?"
Neighbor: "Utility company says 2 hours estimated"
You: "Thanks! Passing that along"

docs.title: Testing Your Setup
docs.text:
You: "Mesh test - can anyone hear me?"
Nearby user: "Got you loud and clear!"

docs.title: At a Festival
docs.text:
You: "Lost my friend near main stage, anyone see someone in a red hat?"
Stranger: "Red hat heading toward food court 5 min ago"

docs.title: For Effective Communication
docs.text:
• Be concise - Keep messages short
  • Identify yourself - "This is Alex from tent 5"
  • Be helpful - Answer questions when you can
  • Stay on topic - Respect the shared space

docs.title: For Privacy
docs.text:
• Use nicknames - Don't use your real name if concerned
  • Move to DMs - For anything private, ask to continue in DM
  • Be vague about location - Don't share exact addresses

docs.title: "I don't see Mesh Group"
docs.text:
• It should appear automatically
  • Check if you have the latest app version
  • Restart the app

docs.title: "Nobody responds to my messages"
docs.text:
• Are others nearby? Check Mesh Lab > Nearby for neighbors
  • Is your mesh working? Test with a known contact via DM
  • Be patient - Others might not be actively watching

docs.title: "Too many messages"
docs.text:
• Mute Mesh Group notifications (Settings > Notifications)
  • The chat remains available, just quieter

docs.title: "I see strange messages"
docs.text:
• Remember, anyone can post
  • Ignore spam or inappropriate content
  • Report persistent issues through the app

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
Aspect Mesh Broadcast Purpose Local mesh chat with anyone nearby Privacy None - messages are plaintext Best for Coordination, emergencies, testing Avoid for Private info, sensitive topics Can disable? Can mute notifications, but stays subscribed

Next: Groups | Channels | Contacts

docs.title: Messaging
docs.text: This guide covers Direct Messages (DMs) - one-to-one encrypted conversations. For group conversations, see Groups. For broadcast channels, see Channels.

docs.title: Direct Messages Overview
docs.text:
Direct messages are:

  • Private - End-to-end encrypted, only you and recipient can read
  • One-to-one - Between you and one other person
  • Offline-capable - Work without internet via mesh
  • Persistent - Stored until delivered or expired

docs.title: Starting a Conversation
docs.text:
From Contacts:

  1. Go to Contacts tab
  2. Tap a contact
  3. Tap Message to start chatting

From Chats:

  1. Go to Chats tab
  2. Tap an existing conversation, or
  3. Tap + to start a new message
  4. Select a contact

docs.title: Composing Messages
docs.text:
1. Tap the text input at the bottom
  2. Type your message
  3. Tap Send (arrow icon)

Your message is:

  1. Encrypted with the recipient's public key
  2. Signed with your private key
  3. Queued for delivery via the mesh

docs.title: What You Can Send
docs.text: Type Supported Notes Text Yes Up to several KB Links Yes Tappable URLs Emoji Yes Standard emoji Files Not yet Planned for future Images Not yet Planned for future Voice Not yet Planned for future

docs.title: Status Icons Explained
docs.text: Icon Status What It Means What to Do Clock Pending Message queued, waiting for relay Wait - a nearby device will relay it Single check Forwarding Handed off to mesh, traveling Message is on its way Double check Delivered Reached recipient's device Done! They received it Warning/X Error Something went wrong Check connectivity, retry "EXP" Expired TTL exceeded before delivery Message won't be delivered

docs.title: Status Flow
docs.text:
Pending → Forwarding → Delivered
    ↓           ↓
  Error      Expired

docs.title: Understanding Delivery Times
docs.text:
Scenario Typical Time Recipient nearby Seconds Same building/event Minutes Same city Hours Different cities Hours to days Remote areas Days or longer

No internet required

Messages travel through device-to-device encounters. More Mycel users = faster delivery.

docs.title: Long-Press Menu
docs.text:
Long-press any message to see actions:

Action Description Copy Copy message text to clipboard Forward Send to another contact/group Delete Remove message Info View message details

docs.title: Copying Messages
docs.text:
1. Long-press the message
  2. Tap Copy
  3. Text is copied to clipboard
  4. Paste anywhere

docs.title: Forwarding Messages
docs.text:
1. Long-press the message
  2. Tap Forward
  3. Select destination:
  4. A contact
  5. A group
  6. A channel (if you're the owner)
  7. Confirm

The forwarded message:

  • Shows as sent by you
  • Doesn't indicate it's forwarded
  • Is re-encrypted for the new recipient

docs.title: Deleting Messages
docs.text:
1. Long-press the message
  2. Tap Delete
  3. Confirm

Local delete only

Deleting removes the message from your device. The recipient still has their copy.

docs.title: Message Info
docs.text:
View details about a message:

  1. Long-press the message
  2. Tap Info
  3. See:
  4. Message ID
  5. Sent timestamp
  6. Delivery status
  7. Encryption status
  8. Recipient info

docs.title: Pinning Conversations
docs.text:
Keep important chats at the top:

  1. Go to Chats > Direct Messages
  2. Swipe right on a conversation
  3. Tap Pin

Pinned conversations:

  • Stay at the top of your list
  • Show a pin indicator
  • Remain pinned until you unpin

To unpin: Swipe right again and tap Unpin

docs.title: Archiving Conversations
docs.text:
Hide inactive chats:

  1. Swipe left on a conversation
  2. Tap Archive

Archived conversations:

  • Move to the Archived tab
  • Don't appear in main list
  • Still receive messages (you'll be notified)

To unarchive:

  1. Go to Archived tab
  2. Swipe left on the conversation
  3. Tap Unarchive

docs.title: Organization Tips
docs.text: Goal Action Prioritize important chats Pin them Clean up old conversations Archive them Find a specific chat Use search

docs.title: Finding Messages
docs.text:
1. Go to Chats
  2. Tap the search icon or search bar
  3. Type your search query

Search looks in:

  • Contact names
  • Message content
  • Group names

docs.title: Search Tips
docs.text:
• Search by name to find a contact quickly
  • Search by keyword to find messages about a topic
  • Partial matches work (searching "meet" finds "meeting")

docs.title: Message Notifications
docs.text:
When you receive a message:

  • Notification appears (if enabled)
  • Badge on app icon updates
  • Unread count shown in Chats tab

docs.title: Notification Settings
docs.text:
Control notifications in Settings > Notifications:

Setting Effect Popup Floating preview appears Sound Audio alert plays Vibration Phone vibrates

docs.title: Per-Conversation Muting
docs.text:
Mute specific conversations:

  1. Open the conversation
  2. Tap the header (contact name)
  3. Toggle Mute
  4. Select duration

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
Every DM is end-to-end encrypted:

  1. Key agreement - Your devices establish a shared secret using X25519
  2. Encryption - Message encrypted with AES-256-GCM
  3. Signing - Message signed with Ed25519 to prove it's from you
  4. Transit - Only encrypted data travels through the mesh
  5. Decryption - Only the recipient's device can decrypt

docs.title: What This Means
docs.text:
• Relay nodes can't read - They only see encrypted blobs
  • We can't read - No server has the keys
  • Only recipient can read - Encryption is to their specific key

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
Each message is cryptographically verified:

  • Signature proves sender identity
  • Encryption ensures only recipient reads
  • Tampering is detected and rejected

docs.title: For Reliability
docs.text:
• Keep app running - Background operation is essential
  • Grant permissions - Location and Bluetooth needed for mesh
  • Be patient - Mesh delivery takes time
  • Check status - Watch for delivery confirmation

docs.title: For Important Messages
docs.text:
• Verify delivery - Wait for double-check before assuming received
  • Use multiple paths - Nostr + Nearby for faster delivery
  • Consider timing - Send when recipient is likely active

docs.title: For Organization
docs.text:
• Pin important contacts - Quick access to frequent chats
  • Archive old conversations - Keep list clean
  • Use search - Find old messages quickly

docs.title: "Message stuck on Pending"
docs.text:
• Check connectivity - Go to Mesh Lab > Nearby
  • Are others nearby? - Need relay devices
  • Wait - Messages queue until opportunity arises
  • Check Queue - Mesh Lab > Queue shows status

docs.title: "Message shows Error"
docs.text:
• Check recipient - Is their UID correct?
  • Retry - Go to Queue, tap message, retry
  • Check connectivity - Ensure mesh is active

docs.title: "Not receiving messages"
docs.text:
• Check notifications - Are they enabled?
  • Check mute - Is the conversation muted?
  • Check background - Is Mycel running?
  • Check battery - Is the app being killed?

docs.title: "Messages taking too long"
docs.text:
• Normal for mesh - Delivery time varies
  • Check Nostr - Internet relay speeds things up
  • More users help - Encourage friends to use Mycel

docs.title: Conversation Types Comparison
docs.text:
Feature Direct Message Group Channel Participants 2 Multiple Unlimited Who can post Both Any member Owner only Encryption E2E Shared key Optional Best for Private chat Team discussion Announcements Guide This page Groups Channels

Next: Groups | Channels | How Delivery Works

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Complete reference for all Mycel settings and configuration options.

docs.title: Accessing Settings
docs.text:
1. Open Mycel
  2. Tap the Settings tab (gear icon)
  3. Browse settings sections

docs.title: Profile
docs.text: Your public identity settings.

docs.title: Display Name
docs.text:
The name others see when you message them.

  • Tap to edit
  • Changes propagate to nearby contacts
  • Keep it recognizable to your friends

docs.title: Full Name (Optional)
docs.text:
An additional name field.

  • Optional - can leave blank
  • Shown in detailed profile views
  • Max 48 characters

docs.title: Your Identity
docs.text:
View your cryptographic identity:

Field Description QR Code Scannable code containing your identity Device UID Unique identifier (short and full) Public Key Your Ed25519 public key Fingerprint 12-character SHA-256 hash Nostr ID Your Nostr public key (if enabled)

docs.title: Actions
docs.text:
• Copy UID - Copy to clipboard
  • Copy Key - Copy public key
  • Share - Share via other apps
  • Scan - Scan another person's QR code

docs.title: Appearance
docs.text: Customize how the app looks.

docs.title: Theme Mode
docs.text: Option Description Light Light background, dark text Dark Dark background, light text System Follow device setting (default)

docs.title: Interface Density
docs.text:
Controls spacing and sizing:

Option Description Compact Smaller elements, more on screen Standard Balanced layout (default) Large Bigger elements, easier to tap

docs.title: Dynamic Color
docs.text:
• On - Uses Android 12+ Material You colors from your wallpaper
  • Off - Uses default Mycel colors

Android 12+ only

Dynamic color requires Android 12 or newer. On older versions, this option has no effect.

docs.title: Notifications
docs.text: Control how Mycel alerts you.

docs.title: Popup Notifications
docs.text: Setting Description Enable popups Show floating notification previews Auto-dismiss Popups disappear automatically Repeat alerts Re-alert for missed notifications

docs.title: Sound & Vibration
docs.text: Setting Description Sound Play notification sound Vibration Vibrate on notification

docs.title: Mesh Group Notifications
docs.text:
Separate toggle for Mesh Broadcast alerts:

  • On - Get notified of Mesh Group messages
  • Off - Messages arrive silently

docs.title: Default Mute Duration
docs.text:
When you mute a conversation, how long:

Option Duration 1 hour Short break 8 hours Workday/sleep 1 day Full day Forever Until manually unmuted

docs.title: Account
docs.text: Quick access to account-related screens.

docs.title: Contacts
docs.text: Opens the Contacts screen for managing your contact list.

docs.title: Diagnostics & Admin
docs.text: Advanced features for troubleshooting and monitoring.

docs.title: Network Details
docs.text:
Opens the Network Screen showing:

  • Device identity
  • H3 geo-tag
  • Neighbor count
  • Connection status

docs.title: Bundle Queue
docs.text:
Opens the Queue Screen showing:

  • Pending messages
  • Delivery status
  • Failed/expired messages

docs.title: System Logs
docs.text:
Opens the Logs Screen for:

  • Real-time event logs
  • Filter by severity
  • Debugging issues

docs.title: Network Screen
docs.text: Detailed view of your mesh network status.

docs.title: Device Identity
docs.text: Field Description Device ID Your unique mesh identifier H3 Geo-Tag Geographic cell for routing Neighbor Count Currently connected peers

docs.title: Location
docs.text:
• Permission status - Whether location is granted
  • Refresh - Update geo-tag manually

docs.title: Capabilities
docs.text:
Shows detected device features:

  • Nearby Connections support
  • Nostr transport
  • BLE support

docs.title: Queue Screen
docs.text: Monitor your message queue.

docs.title: Outbox Tab
docs.text:
Messages you've sent, grouped by status:

Status Meaning NEW Just created FWD Being forwarded RECEIVED Peer acknowledged DELIVERED Fully delivered ERROR Failed EXPIRED TTL exceeded CANCELLED User cancelled

docs.title: Inbox Tab
docs.text: Messages you've received.

docs.title: Actions
docs.text:
• Tap a message to view details
  • Delete - Remove from queue
  • Retry - Re-attempt delivery

docs.title: Logs Screen
docs.text: Real-time system logs for troubleshooting.

docs.title: Log Levels
docs.text:
Filter by severity:

Level Color Use Debug Gray Detailed technical info Info Blue Normal operations Warning Yellow Potential issues Error Red Problems

docs.title: Log Entry Format
docs.text:
Each entry shows:

  • Timestamp
  • Level
  • Tag (component)

docs.title: Using Logs
docs.text:
Logs help diagnose:

  • Connection issues

  • App crashes

docs.title: Mesh Lab
docs.text: The Mesh Lab tab (separate from Settings) provides detailed network diagnostics.

docs.title: Nearby Tab
docs.text:
Bluetooth/Wi-Fi mesh status:

Field Description Neighbors List of connected peers Sessions Active connection sessions Discovery Recent device discoveries Errors Connection problems

docs.title: Nostr Tab
docs.text:
Internet relay status:

Field Description Connected relays Active Nostr connections Relay health Connection status per relay Sync progress Message synchronization

docs.title: Logs Tab
docs.text: Same as Diagnostics > System Logs.

docs.title: Battery & Background
docs.text: Critical for mesh operation.

docs.title: Why Background Matters
docs.text:
Mycel needs to run in the background to:

  • Discover nearby devices
  • Relay messages for others
  • Receive incoming messages
  • Maintain mesh connectivity

docs.title: Battery Optimization Warning
docs.text:
If battery optimization is enabled for Mycel:

  • The app may be killed in background
  • Mesh connectivity suffers
  • Message delivery is delayed

docs.title: Fixing Battery Issues
docs.text:
1. Check status - Look for warning in Settings
  2. Open battery settings - Tap the warning
  3. Exclude Mycel - Set to "Don't optimize" or "Unrestricted"

docs.title: OEM-Specific Issues
docs.text:
Some manufacturers (Samsung, Xiaomi, Oppo, etc.) have aggressive battery management:

Severity Manufacturers High Samsung, Oppo, Vivo, OnePlus, Xiaomi Medium Huawei, Honor Low Google Pixel, stock Android

The app detects your device and provides specific instructions.

More details: Battery & Background

docs.title: For Best Connectivity
docs.text: Setting Recommendation Battery optimization Disabled for Mycel Location permission Always allow Bluetooth On Wi-Fi On Background activity Unrestricted

docs.title: For Battery Saving
docs.text:
If battery is a concern:

Setting Recommendation Mesh Group notifications Off Popup notifications Off Interface density Compact

Note: Some battery saving measures reduce mesh effectiveness.

docs.title: For Privacy
docs.text: Setting Recommendation Display name Use a nickname Full name Leave blank

docs.title: Data Storage
docs.text: All settings are stored locally on your device.

docs.title: Settings Files
docs.text: File Contents settings_prefs.json Theme, density, colors identity_prefs.json Name, profile notification_prefs.json Notification settings chat_prefs.json Pins, archives

docs.title: No Cloud Sync
docs.text:
• Settings don't sync to any server
  • Reinstalling = fresh start
  • Each device has independent settings

docs.title: "Settings don't save"
docs.text:
• Ensure the app has storage permission
  • Try restarting the app
  • Check available storage space

docs.title: "Theme doesn't change"
docs.text:
• On some devices, requires app restart
  • Check if system theme override is active

docs.title: "Notifications don't work"
docs.text:
1. Check Mycel notification permission in Android settings
  2. Check notification channel settings
  3. Verify Mycel isn't in "Do Not Disturb" block list
  4. Check battery optimization isn't killing the app

docs.title: "Can't access Mesh Lab"
docs.text:
• Mesh Lab is a separate tab, not in Settings
  • Look for it in the bottom navigation bar
  • May be labeled differently on some versions

Next: Messaging | Contacts | Battery & Background

docs.title: Mycel
docs.text:
پیام‌رسانی که بدون اینترنت کار می‌کند.

Mycel یک پیام‌رسان مش با تحمل تأخیر برای اندروید است. پیام‌ها را با انتقال بین گوشی‌های نزدیک ارسال می‌کند تا به مقصد برسند - بدون نیاز به دکل موبایل، Wi-Fi یا سرور.

docs.title: به کجا می‌خواهید بروید؟
docs.text: می‌خواهم... از اینجا شروع کنید از Mycel استفاده کنم شروع کار - نصب، راه‌اندازی، ارسال پیام نحوه کار را بفهمم نحوه کار - شبکه مش، تحویل، انتقال‌ها جزئیات فنی را ببینم عمیق‌تر - پروتکل‌ها، الگوریتم‌ها، معماری درباره امنیت بدانم امنیت - رمزنگاری، حریم خصوصی، مدل تهدید

docs.title: چرا Mycel؟
docs.text:
پیام‌رسان‌های معمولی برای کار به اینترنت نیاز دارند. وقتی شبکه قطع می‌شود - در مواقع اضطراری، مناطق دورافتاده، یا وقتی زیرساخت مسدود شده - ارتباط متوقف می‌شود.

Mycel با تبدیل هر گوشی به یک رله، شما را متصل نگه می‌دارد. پیام شما از دستگاهی به دستگاه دیگر می‌پرد، توسط افرادی که در دنیا حرکت می‌کنند حمل می‌شود، تا به دوست شما برسد.

مناسب برای:

  • مواقع اضطراری - در ارتباط بمانید وقتی شبکه‌ها قطع هستند
  • مناطق دورافتاده - بدون پوشش موبایل ارتباط برقرار کنید
  • رویدادها و جشن‌ها - به دوستان در مکان‌های شلوغ با شبکه‌های بیش از حد بارگذاری شده پیام دهید
  • کاربران حساس به حریم خصوصی - بدون سرور برای ذخیره متادیتای شما

docs.title: نحوه کار (۳۰ ثانیه)
docs.text:
sequenceDiagram
    participant A as گوشی شما
    participant B as گوشی نزدیک
    participant C as گوشی دوست
    A->>B: پیام تحویل داده شد
    Note right of B: پیام را حمل می‌کند<br/>تا برخورد بعدی
    B->>C: پیام تحویل داده شد
    C-->>A: تحویل تأیید شد
  1. پیام ارسال می‌کنید - گوشی شما کاربران Mycel نزدیک را جستجو می‌کند
  2. پیام از مش عبور می‌کند - هر گوشی پیام شما را ذخیره و فوروارد می‌کند
  3. تحویل انجام می‌شود - وقتی زنجیره‌ای از اتصالات به دوست شما برسد، پیام می‌رسد
  4. تأییدیه دریافت می‌کنید - یک تأییدیه برای اطمینان از تحویل برمی‌گردد

انتظارات زمان تحویل

پیام‌ها می‌توانند در ثانیه (اگر نزدیک باشید) یا ساعت‌ها/روزها (اگر دور باشید) برسند. این عادی است - Mycel تحویل فوری را با توانایی کار در هر جا معاوضه می‌کند.

docs.title: ویژگی‌های کلیدی
docs.text: ویژگی توضیحات آفلاین-اول بدون هیچ اتصال اینترنتی کار می‌کند رمزنگاری سرتاسر فقط شما و گیرنده می‌توانید پیام‌ها را بخوانید بدون سرور مرکزی پیام‌ها به صورت همتا-به-همتا سفر می‌کنند، بدون شرکت واسط چند-انتقالی از بلوتوث، Wi-Fi Direct و رله اینترنتی اختیاری استفاده می‌کند ذخیره-و-فوروارد پیام‌ها تا تحویل باقی می‌مانند، حتی اگر روزها طول بکشد

docs.title: شروع سریع
docs.text:
1. دانلود APK از GitHub Releases
  2. نصب و راه‌اندازی روی دستگاه اندروید (نیاز به نصب دستی دارد)
  3. ارسال اولین پیام

به‌روز بمانید

برای به‌روزرسانی خودکار، از Obtainium استفاده کنید - GitHub را برای نسخه‌های جدید بررسی می‌کند و آن‌ها را برای شما نصب می‌کند.

docs.title: برای کاربران
docs.text:
1. نصب برنامه
  2. اعطای مجوزها
  3. ارسال اولین پیام
  4. درک زمان‌های تحویل
  5. نکات باتری و پس‌زمینه

docs.title: برای توسعه‌دهندگان
docs.text:
1. نمای کلی معماری
  2. جریان پیام
  3. الگوریتم‌های مسیریابی
  4. انتزاع‌های انتقال

docs.title: متن‌باز
docs.text:
Mycel نرم‌افزار متن‌باز است. منبع مستندات: github.com/ethene/mycel-docs.

Mycel v2.1.1

docs.title: چشم‌انداز
docs.text: Mycel یک پیام‌رسان برای افرادی است که دسترسی قابل اعتماد به اینترنت ندارند.

docs.title: مشکل
docs.text:
۳.۷ میلیارد نفر دسترسی قابل اعتماد به اینترنت ندارند. آن‌ها نمی‌توانند از برنامه‌های پیام‌رسانی مدرن استفاده کنند. راه‌حل‌های موجود نیاز دارند به:

  • اتصال اینترنت دائمی (واتس‌اپ، تلگرام، سیگنال)
  • سخت‌افزار ماهواره‌ای گران (استارلینک)
  • زیرساخت پیچیده (شبکه‌های LoRa)

Mycel با آنچه مردم از قبل دارند کار می‌کند: گوشی‌های اندروید با بلوتوث.

docs.title: نحوه کار Mycel
docs.text:
Mycel از DTN واقعی (شبکه با تحمل تأخیر) استفاده می‌کند: پیام‌ها بین گوشی‌ها می‌پرند تا به مقصد برسند - در یک روستا، یک شهر، یا سراسر جهان.

گوشی آلیس → [ذخیره پیام] → باب رد می‌شود → [پیام می‌پرد] →
→ [دوباره می‌پرد] → ... → به گیرنده می‌رسد (ساعت‌ها/روزها بعد)

پیام‌ها روی دستگاه‌ها ذخیره می‌مانند و وقتی کاربران Mycel دیگر در برد بلوتوث قرار می‌گیرند فرصت‌طلبانه فوروارد می‌شوند. بدون ایستگاه پایه. بدون نیاز به اینترنت.

docs.title: تحویل می‌تواند زمان ببرد
docs.text:
این یک باگ نیست - یک ویژگی است. Mycel تحویل فوری را با توانایی کار در هر جایی مبادله می‌کند:

سناریو زمان معمول یک اتاق ثانیه‌ها یک محله دقیقه تا ساعت یک شهر ساعت‌ها شهرهای مختلف ساعت‌ها تا روزها مناطق دورافتاده روزها یا بیشتر

docs.title: مدل انتقال یکپارچه
docs.text:
همه انتقال‌ها یک شبکه منطقی واحد را تشکیل می‌دهند. کاربران تفاوتی بین مش محلی و مسیریابی اینترنت جهانی نمی‌بینند.

انتقال نوع محدوده اتصالات نزدیک BLE/WiFi مش محلی (۱۰۰-۳۰۰ متر) رله‌های Nostr WebSocket جهانی از طریق رله‌های اینترنتی آینده: LoRa رادیو برد بلند (کیلومترها)

مسیریابی به طور خودکار بهترین مسیر موجود را انتخاب می‌کند. وقتی اینترنت دارید، پیام‌ها سریع‌تر می‌روند. وقتی ندارید، از طریق مش سفر می‌کنند.

docs.title: ۱. اول آفلاین
docs.text: اینترنت یک امتیاز است، نه یک نیاز. هر ویژگی بدون اتصال کار می‌کند.

docs.title: ۲. استفاده از سخت‌افزار موجود
docs.text: نیازی به تجهیزات خاص نیست - فقط یک گوشی اندروید با بلوتوث.

docs.title: ۳. حریم خصوصی با طراحی
docs.text:
• رمزنگاری سرتاسری برای همه پیام‌ها
  • هویت‌های چرخشی از ردیابی جلوگیری می‌کنند
  • هیچ سرور مرکزی داده‌های شما را ذخیره نمی‌کند

docs.title: ۴. ساده برای کاربران
docs.text: مسیریابی پیچیده پشت رابط کاربری تمیز پنهان شده. شما پیام می‌فرستید؛ راهش را پیدا می‌کند.

docs.title: ۵. تاب‌آور
docs.text: پیام‌ها در نهایت می‌رسند علیرغم قطعی شبکه، راه‌اندازی مجدد گوشی، و اتصالات قطع‌شده.

docs.title: انواع پیام
docs.text: نوع توضیح رمزنگاری پیام‌های مستقیم فرد به فرد سرتاسری رمزنگاری‌شده گروه‌های خصوصی فقط با دعوت، هر عضو می‌تواند بنویسد کلید گروه اشتراکی کانال‌ها پخش فقط توسط ادمین امضا شده توسط ادمین

docs.title: اصلی
docs.text:
افراد در مناطق با اینترنت نامطمئن یا بدون اینترنت:

  • جوامع روستایی
  • مناطق در حال توسعه
  • سناریوهای بحران/اضطراری
  • شرایط اعتراضی
  • رویدادهای با شبکه‌های اشباع‌شده

docs.title: ثانویه
docs.text: کاربران حساس به حریم خصوصی که پیام‌رسانی محلی-اول بدون سرورهای شرکتی می‌خواهند.

docs.title: بنیاد فنی
docs.text:
Mycel بر فناوری‌های اثبات‌شده ساخته شده است:

جزء فناوری پروتکل DTN (شبکه با تحمل تأخیر) مسیریابی ترکیب PRoPHET + پاشش-و-صبر رمزنگاری تبادل کلید X25519، AES-256-GCM امضاها Ed25519 انتقال محلی Google Nearby Connections (BLE/WiFi) انتقال اینترنتی رله‌های Nostr (NIP-17) مسیریابی جغرافیایی شبکه شش‌ضلعی H3

docs.title: آینده
docs.text:
Mycel در حال تکامل به سمت یک اکوسیستم گسترده‌تر است:

  • ادغام LoRa برای مش برد بلند (احتمالاً از طریق Meshtastic)
  • ادغام اکوسیستم با وب غیرمتمرکز گسترده‌تر
  • کلاینت‌های iOS و دسکتاپ (بلندمدت)

هدف ما: پیام‌ها راهشان را پیدا می‌کنند.

docs.title: متن‌باز
docs.text:
Mycel نرم‌افزار متن‌باز است. کد برای بازرسی و مشارکت در دسترس است.

«Mycel: پیام‌ها راهشان را پیدا می‌کنند.»

docs.title: اولین قدم‌ها
docs.text: پس از نصب Mycel، هویت خود را تنظیم کرده و نحوه ارسال پیام را یاد می‌گیرید.

docs.title: راه‌اندازی اولیه
docs.text:
وقتی برای اولین بار Mycel را باز می‌کنید:

  1. مجوزها را اعطا کنید - Mycel برای کشف دستگاه‌های نزدیک به مجوزهای بلوتوث و موقعیت نیاز دارد (برای دلیل آن به مجوزها مراجعه کنید)
  2. هویت شما ایجاد می‌شود - Mycel یک هویت رمزنگاری منحصربه‌فرد (جفت کلید عمومی/خصوصی) تولید می‌کند
  3. آماده هستید - بدون نیاز به ثبت‌نام حساب یا شماره تلفن

هویت شما محلی است

کلیدهای رمزنگاری شما روی دستگاهتان می‌مانند. حسابی برای ایجاد یا سروری برای ثبت‌نام وجود ندارد.

docs.title: درک هویت شما
docs.text:
Mycel شما را با یک شناسه دستگاه شناسایی می‌کند - یک کد کوتاه که از کلید عمومی شما مشتق شده است. دیگران از این برای افزودن شما به عنوان مخاطب استفاده می‌کنند.

برای یافتن شناسه دستگاه خود:

  1. Mycel را باز کنید
  2. به تنظیمات بروید یا روی پروفایل خود بزنید
  3. شناسه شما نمایش داده می‌شود (می‌توانید برای کپی روی آن بزنید)

این شناسه را با دوستان به اشتراک بگذارید تا بتوانند به شما پیام بدهند.

docs.title: افزودن مخاطبین
docs.text:
برای پیام دادن به کسی، به شناسه دستگاه او نیاز دارید:

  1. روی + یا افزودن مخاطب بزنید
  2. شناسه دستگاه او را وارد کنید
  3. اختیاری یک نام مستعار اضافه کنید
  4. مخاطب را ذخیره کنید

حالا می‌توانید به او پیام بدهید.

docs.title: ارسال اولین پیام
docs.text:
1. یک مخاطب را از لیست انتخاب کنید
  2. پیام خود را بنویسید
  3. روی ارسال بزنید

پیام شما یکی از این وضعیت‌ها را نشان می‌دهد:

وضعیت معنی در انتظار منتظر یک دستگاه نزدیک برای رله کردن در حال ارسال تحویل داده شده، در حال عبور از مش تحویل شده به دستگاه دوستتان رسید

پیام‌ها ممکن است زمان ببرند

بر خلاف پیام‌رسان‌های فوری، پیام‌های Mycel از طریق برخوردهای فیزیکی سفر می‌کنند. تحویل می‌تواند دقیقه‌ها، ساعت‌ها یا حتی روزها طول بکشد بسته به فاصله و تعداد کاربران Mycel در اطراف.

docs.title: شبکه مش
docs.text:
Mycel به طور خودکار:

  • دستگاه شما را برای کاربران Mycel نزدیک تبلیغ می‌کند
  • دستگاه‌های Mycel دیگر در محدوده را کشف می‌کند
  • با دستگاه‌های مواجه شده پیام‌ها را تبادل می‌کند

نیازی نیست کاری انجام دهید - فقط برنامه را در حال اجرا نگه دارید (در پس‌زمینه کار می‌کند).

docs.title: نکاتی برای اتصال بهتر
docs.text:
• بلوتوث و وای‌فای را روشن نگه دارید - هر دو برای کشف استفاده می‌شوند
  • فعالیت پس‌زمینه را مجاز کنید - برنامه را به زور متوقف نکنید
  • حرکت کنید - برخوردهای بیشتر = تحویل سریع‌تر
  • کاربران بیشتر = مش بهتر - دوستان را به استفاده از Mycel دعوت کنید

docs.title: مراحل بعدی
docs.text:
• به‌روزرسانی برنامه - Mycel را به‌روز نگه دارید
  • مجوزها - بفهمید چرا هر مجوز لازم است
  • نحوه تحویل - درباره مسیریابی پیام یاد بگیرید

docs.title: دریافت کمک
docs.text: با Mycel به کمک نیاز دارید؟ در اینجا نحوه دریافت پشتیبانی و ارتباط با جامعه آمده است.

docs.title: راه‌حل‌های سریع
docs.text:
قبل از تماس، این منابع را امتحان کنید:

مشکل راه‌حل برنامه کار نمی‌کند بررسی کنید مجوزها اعطا شده باشند پیام‌ها گیر کرده‌اند به نحوه تحویل مراجعه کنید مصرف باتری به باتری و پس‌زمینه مراجعه کنید سوالات عمومی سوالات متداول را بررسی کنید

docs.title: جامعه تلگرام
docs.text:
به جامعه Mycel در تلگرام بپیوندید:

@mycel_app

این مکان اصلی برای:

  • پرسیدن سوالات
  • گزارش مشکلات
  • به اشتراک گذاشتن بازخورد
  • ارتباط با کاربران دیگر
  • دریافت اطلاعیه‌ها درباره به‌روزرسانی‌ها

docs.title: گزارش باگ
docs.text:
باگی پیدا کردید؟ در گیت‌هاب گزارش دهید:

github.com/ethene/mycel-releases/issues

هنگام گزارش، لطفاً شامل کنید:

  • نسخه اندروید شما
  • مدل دستگاه شما
  • مراحل بازتولید مشکل
  • اسکرین‌شات در صورت مرتبط بودن

docs.title: درخواست ویژگی
docs.text: ایده‌ای برای Mycel دارید؟ در GitHub Issues درخواست ویژگی باز کنید.

docs.title: مستندات
docs.text:
این سایت مستندات شامل:

  • شروع کار - نصب و راه‌اندازی
  • راهنمای کاربر - استفاده روزانه
  • نحوه کار - درک مش
  • عمیق‌تر - جزئیات فنی
  • امنیت - حریم خصوصی و رمزنگاری

docs.title: قبل از درخواست کمک
docs.text:
برای دریافت بهترین کمک، لطفاً ارائه دهید:

  1. چه امتحان کردید - مراحلی که انجام دادید
  2. چه اتفاقی افتاد - نتیجه واقعی
  3. چه انتظاری داشتید - نتیجه مطلوب
  4. اطلاعات دستگاه - نسخه اندروید، مدل دستگاه
  5. نسخه برنامه - در تنظیمات یافت می‌شود

docs.title: مشارکت
docs.text:
می‌خواهید به بهبود Mycel کمک کنید؟

  • گزارش باگ - به ما کمک کنید مشکلات را پیدا کنیم
  • پیشنهاد ویژگی - ایده‌های خود را به اشتراک بگذارید
